item.title: Introducing the Model Context Protocol
item.description: The Model Context Protocol (MCP) is an open standard for connecting AI assistants to the systems where data lives, including content repositories, business tools, and development environments. Its aim is to help frontier models produce better, more relevant responses.

item.title: OpenAPI document generation in .NET 9 - .NET Blog
item.description: Introducing the New OpenAPI Document Generation Feature in .NET 9. Let's take a look at what it is, how to use it, and how it streamlines API development in .NET.

item.description: The dream of a single dialect-free C++ has probably been dead for many years, anyway.

item.title: Tech Companies Are MISSING OUT On Prioritizing This Skill
item.description:
And what could this super important skill be that tech companies aren't putting priority on?
JavaScript? Postgres? Blazor?
Is it some other programming language or tech stack? Or maybe some other technical skills like debugging?
... Think again.
In this video, let's jump over to Reddit and read through this realization from a software engineer that after FIVE years he claims "I realize companies don't place value on this".

item.title: Finally! Azure Service Bus Emulator is Now Available!
item.description:
Are you building a scalable, decoupled application together with a service bus?
If you're using Azure Service Bus, you've probably felt the pain of local development!
Up until now, there hasn't been a way to work with Azure Service Bus without setting that up in Azure, which costs money, and requires you to always be online.
Let me introduce the Azure Service Bus Emulator that solves this problem. You can now run the emulator in docker, locally, and point your application to the local instance. This will let you build an application that uses Azure Service Bus without relying on Azure during the development process!
Join me in this video where we explore this new tool, and set it up using .NET Aspire!
Table of contents: 00:00: Introduction 02:15: Introducing Azure Service Bus Emulator 03:35: Docker Compose 05:00: Setting it up with Aspire 05:30: Adding the container to Aspire 06:00: Container to Container communication 08:00: Azure Service Bus Emulator Running with Aspire 08:24: Connect to the Service Bus
Follow me on X: @fekberg Check out my courses on Pluralsight: https://pluralsight.pxf.io/d1MRK
DISCLAIMER: This video and description contains affiliate links, which means that if you click on one of the links, I may receive a small commission.
item.author: (Filip Ekberg)

item.title: Insane performance boost in EF core using bulk operations #dotnet #aspnetcore #csharp #efcore
item.description: In this video, I dive into the insane performance boost you can achieve in .NET by leveraging bulk operations with ExecuteUpdateAsync and ExecuteDeleteAsync from EF Core. I demonstrate two approaches for updating and deleting records: the traditional method that loads entities into memory and processes them using foreach loops, and the optimized bulk operation method. The difference? 6 seconds vs. 0.1 seconds!
item.author: (Remigiusz Zalewski)

item.title: Wireguard: Beyond the most basic configuration
item.description: Last week I wanted to replace my OpenVPN setup with WireGuard. The basics were well-documented, going beyond the basics was a bit trickier. Let me teach you want I learned. The basics But first, let’s summarize the basics. I have a server with a hosting provider that I want to use as a VPN server. I won’t delve into details here, since there are so many great explanations on the web already (here, here, here or here), let’s just make a quick summary of a simple setup, as a base for discussing the (slightly) more advanced usages I had to configure myself:

item.title: "Always use early returns" - LinkedIn Edition
item.description: A dear LinkedIn - a pool of gems where everyone is expert in everything. Over the time I collected some trophies from there and today I want to discuss one of them: "Always use early returns".

item.title: Dear friend, you have built a Kubernetes
RFC 35140: The Do-Not-Stab flag in the HTTP Header
item.description: Date: March 7, 2111 Abstract This document defines the syntax and semantics of the Do-Not-Stab header, a proposed HTTP header that allows users to indicate to a website their preferences about being stabbed. It also provides a standard for how services should comply with such user preferences, if they wish to.

item.title: Secure Your ASP.NET Apps with JSON Web Tokens in C# - Step-by-Step Guide!
item.description:
Learn how to secure your ASP.NET applications with JSON Web Tokens (JWTs) in this beginner-friendly tutorial. I’ll walk through setting up authentication, generating JWTs, and validating them using C#. This guide is perfect for software engineers looking to add secure authentication to their apps. Whether you’re developing APIs or web applications, this is a must-watch!
✅ Topics Covered:
What are JWTs and why use them? Generating secure tokens in ASP.NET Implementing authentication and authorization
Subscribe for more .NET and C# content!
#ASPNET #CSharp #JWT #SecureApps #dotnet #json #softwaredevelopment #tech #code
item.author: (Nick Proud)
